content: this pattern is also available for free on my website here 1 use those leftover skeins of super bulky yarn and make a c2c moss stitch baby blanket for charity i am so excited about these colors and the way this project turned out i had lots of teal blue gray and white super bulky yarns in my stash from past baby blanket projects i was eager to create a sort of eclectic but charming baby blanket with the leftovers when i saw warm up america was doing a baby blanket charity drive i set to work that night making this baby blanket abbreviations us chain s chain s pm place marker in the stitch you just created unless otherwise indicated repeat repeat round round single_crochet s single_crochet s slip_stitch s slip_stitch es skip skip space s space s st s stitch es notes you ll notice in the pattern i am liberal about the use of stitch markers i highly suggest using them during the first few row until the pattern is clearly formed and always during the start and end of row if you include some weight 5 bulky yarn in your project like i did i suggest holding two strands together this will help achieve a similar weight to the size 6 yarns comprising the majority of the blanket for a visual tutorial on the c2c moss stitch you can check out the c2c moss stitch class i taught for favecrafts studio live to adjust the size of this blanket complete any number of increase row 1 https //dananield com/super-bulky-c2c-moss-stitch-baby-blanket-for-charity/
